Recent updates in NYC include tragic flooding resulting in two fatalities, a pedestrian fatality in Brooklyn, and swift restoration of gas service after a leak. Additionally, the City Council approved the redevelopment of Kingsbridge Armory, while discussions on housing policies and public safety continue amid ongoing challenges.

### Risks & Alerts

- NYC flooding has resulted in the deaths of two men in flooded basements in Manhattan and Brooklyn. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- A man was killed and another injured after being struck by a Ford vehicle in Brooklyn; the driver remained on scene. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Gas service has been restored at 140 Claremont Avenue following a reported leak. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMisgFBVV95cUxQeXUwZmpLbzByT1FOa3pCYkNxWkstT2ZKemd1ZFJGa0lCWDJSeVBSMlNJR3lNRDRSUHh4VE8yNGJleHhHNE0tNVlPNjIyblpaY200ZGVVWWVfM0NmYjY4UEtNNnpiZEtReFdOZ0xBYTJCekEzTXhRYmlCMXBybnQtaTlCM0t4eFFETV90dDE0bHI1c2c2bEpvUXhfVEcyVml4UnFrVGdFS3dfQkVjVGp6M1h3?oc=5)

### Civics & Politics
